intro: Graptopetalum occidentale, commonly known as the Eastern stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It features fleshy, blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern, which helps it store water and reduce transpiration. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow to orange during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-draining soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its drought tolerance and low maintenance requirements make it well-suited for arid and semi-arid climates.
